member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.INodePool`1.GetPreviousDisplayedLayoutSlot(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the layout slot associated with the displayed elements. This method reliably returns the last valid displayed state even if node pool is currently recycled.

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.LayoutDoubleUtil.AreClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: AreClose - Returns whether or not two doubles are "close". That is, whether or not they are within epsilon of each other. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the AreClose comparison.

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.LayoutDoubleUtil.GreaterThan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: GreaterThan - Returns whether or not the first double is greater than the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly greater than *and* not within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the GreaterThan comparison.

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.LayoutDoubleUtil.GreaterThanOrClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: GreaterThanOrClose - Returns whether or not the first double is greater than or close to the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly greater than or within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the GreaterThanOrClose comparison.

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.LayoutDoubleUtil.IsZero(System.Double)
member.summary: IsZero - Returns whether or not the double is "close" to 0. Same as AreClose(double, 0), but this is faster.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the IsZero comparison.

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.LayoutDoubleUtil.LessThan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: LessThan - Returns whether or not the first double is less than the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly less than *and* not within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the LessThan comparison.

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.LayoutDoubleUtil.LessThanOrClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: LessThanOrClose - Returns whether or not the first double is less than or close to the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly less than or within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the LessThanOrClose comparison.

member.summary: Gets the collection of objects that defines the current sorting within this instance. Multiple sort descriptors define a sorting operation by multiple keys.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.GroupDescriptors
member.summary: Gets the collection of objects that defines the current grouping within this instance. Multiple group descriptors define multiple group levels.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.FilterDescriptors
member.summary: Gets the collection of objects that defines the current filtering within this instance.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.AggregateDescriptors
member.summary: Gets the collection of objects that defines the current aggregate functions to be applied when the data view is computed.

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.GetDataView
member.summary: Gets the instance that can be used to traverse and/or manipulate the data after all the Sort, Group and Filter operations are applied.

member.name: E:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.SelectionChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the currently selected items change.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.SelectionUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the selection unit of the DataGrid. The default value is DataGridSelectionUnit.Row
member.example:
XAML
<telerikGrid:RadDataGrid x:Name="dataGrid" SelectionUnit="Cell"/>
C#
this.dataGrid.SelectionUnit = DataGridSelectionUnit.Cell;

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.SelectionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the selection mode of the DataGrid. The default value is DataGridSelectionMode.Single.
member.example:
XAML
<telerikGrid:RadDataGrid x:Name="dataGrid" SelectionMode="Multiple"/>
C#
this.dataGrid.SelectionMode = DataGridSelectionMode.Multiple;

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.SelectedItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the selected item of the DataGrid.
member.remarks: When the value of the is , the selected item is of type . When the value of the is , the selected item is of the same type as the business object.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.SelectionStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the that defines the appearance settings applied to the selection.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.SelectedItems
member.summary: Gets the currently selected items within this instance. The type of items within the collection depends on the current value: - The data item (row) when the selection unit is . - A object when the selection unit is .

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.SelectItem(System.Object)
member.summary: Selects the specified data item and adds it in the collection.
member.remarks: In order to select a Row, the value should be DataGridSelectionUnit.Row.

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.DeselectItem(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the selection for the specified data item and removes it from the collection.

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.SelectCell(Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.DataGridCellInfo)
member.summary: Selects the grid cell as defined by the specified cell info.
member.remarks: In order to select a cell, the value should be DataGridSelectionUnit.Cell.

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.DeselectCell(Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.DataGridCellInfo)
member.summary: Removes the selection for the grid cell defined by the specified cell info.

member.summary: Selects all the items as defined by the and

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.RadDataGrid.DeselectAll
member.summary: Clears the current selection state.

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.Commands.DataGridCommandService.ExecuteCommand(Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.Commands.DataGridCommandId,System.Object)
member.summary: Attempts to find the command, associated with the specified Id and to perform its Execute routine, using the provided parameter.
member.param: The parameter that is passed to the CanExecute and Execute methods of the command.
member.returns: True if the command is successfully executed, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.Commands.DataGridCommandService.ExecuteDefaultCommand(Telerik.XamarinForms.DataGrid.Commands.DataGridCommandId,System.Object)
member.summary: Executes the default (built-in) command (without looking for user-defined commands), associated with the specified Id.
member.param: The parameter that is passed to the CanExecute and Execute methods of the command.
member.returns: True if the command is successfully executed, false otherwise.

member.remarks: The coordinates are relative to the current instance.
